title: Chemistry for sixth forms: catalysis
creator_credit: Phil Wrestler, Donald Carter and Associated Television
brief_description: The term “catalysis” and its importance in industrial processes; homogeneous and heterogeneous catalysis; catalytic cracking of petroleum; Faraday’s theory on the cause of surface catalysis; Sabatier-Senderens process using nickel as a catalyst in hydrogenation of vegetable oils; effect of poisons on surface catalysis; effect of manganese dioxide on hydrogen peroxide.
creator_credit_for_label: Phil Wrestler, Donald Carter and Associated Television
